bibl.note: This document is a letter written by W. C. Hamilton to Doctor J. L. Alexander on July 23, 1839. In the letter, Hamilton informs Alexander that he will not be visiting him because Colonel Polk will not be there, and also that he wishes for him to attend a meeting of candidates in Hartsville, Tennessee.

div1.p: Having declined visiting you on next Saturday as Col Polk will not be there I take the liberty to address you a few lines although notwithstanding I have not anything new at present therefore my letter will be short.

The intention of this letter is to inform you that on next fryday the candidates have a meeting in this place and I wish you to come down on that day I wish to see you. I expect there will be a good many here on that day and if you will come we will take the visit we spoke of when I was up there. You must be certain to come for I will look for you — we are all in a state of health in this country
